title: Using NFS server with mlflow.log_artifact() .No proper documntation on mlflow.org

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

body:
Hi, I have been trying to to use mlflow for storing params, metrics and artifacts(models) for my deep learning experiments. Till now, I have able to achieve following things:
 1) Setting up mlflow server on a remote machine and running the python script from another client machine
 2) Able to successfully store the params and metrics on the remote server, but `log_artifacts()` is not saving the artifacts remotely, in fact it stores locally in ./mlrun folder. 

Now, I just want to figure out a way to log artifacts remotely, which I have been struggling with since a day. On reading github issues, it seems that using NFS, SFTP and HDFS could help. However, I couldn't find a proper documentation for using NFS server with mlflow, and hence request anyone who has used NFS or other method to successfully store the artifacts.

 I look forward to a solution at the earliest. Thanks in advance.

Regards,
Nakul
